explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 prohibits modifying a function parameter. In metal_io_block_set the parameter len is assigned and mutated: e.g. "if ((offset + len) > io->size) len = io->size - offset;" and later in the loops (len--, len -= sizeof(int), etc.). Although the code preserves the original length in retlen, that does not avoid the rule violation. (Modifying the local pointer ptr is allowed per the rule.) To comply, introduce a local variable (e.g. remaining or rem_len) initialized from len and modify that instead of the parameter.
